Package dev.kkorolyov.simplefiles

Class Providers<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • dev.kkorolyov.simplefiles.Providers<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<T>
    public final class Providers<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<T>
    Loads providers/implementations of a service. Similar to ServiceLoader, but provides additional functionality, such as instantiating providers with constructor arguments and loading from multiple resources.

    • Method Detail

      • fromDescriptor

        public static <T> Providers<T> fromDescriptor​(java.lang.Class<T> serviceType,
                                              java.lang.Object... args)
        Loads providers from classes defined as service providers in module-info files on the modulepath. Though module descriptors require providers to have public, no-arg constructors, this method will still attempt to instantiate with args just like fromConfig(Class, Object...).
        Type Parameters:
        T - service type
        Parameters:
        serviceType - service type to load providers for
        args - constructor arguments for each provider instance
        Returns:
        providers loaded from classes defined as service providers for serviceType and instantiated with args
        See Also:
        fromClasses(Class, Iterable, Object...)

      • fromConfig

        public static <T> Providers<T> fromConfig​(java.lang.Class<T> serviceType,
                                          java.lang.Object... args)
        Loads providers from classes defined in each META-INF/services/{fullyQualifiedServiceName} configuration file on the classpath.
        Type Parameters:
        T - service type
        Parameters:
        serviceType - service type to load providers for
        args - constructor arguments for each provider instance
        Returns:
        providers loaded from classes in each configuration file for serviceType and instantiated with args
        Throws:
        java.io.UncheckedIOException - if an IO issue occurs
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if multiple configuration files define the same class
        See Also:
        fromClassNames(Class, Iterable, Object...)

      • fromClassNames

        public static <T> Providers<T> fromClassNames​(java.lang.Class<T> serviceType,
                                              java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> classNames,
                                              java.lang.Object... args)
        Generates providers from supplied class names.
        Type Parameters:
        T - service type
        Parameters:
        serviceType - provider service type
        classNames - fully-qualified names of classes to instantiate as providers
        args - constructor arguments for each provider instance
        Returns:
        providers instantiated from each class in classNames with args
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any class in classNames is not an instance of serviceType
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if any class in classNames is not on the classpath
        See Also:
        fromClasses(Class, Iterable, Object...)

      • fromClasses

        public static <T> Providers<T> fromClasses​(java.lang.Class<T> serviceType,
                                           java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Class<? extends T>> classes,
                                           java.lang.Object... args)
        Generates providers from new instances of supplied classes. Providers are instantiated using the constructor matching args. If a provider does not contain a constructor matching args, its no-arg constructor is used instead.
        Type Parameters:
        T - service type
        Parameters:
        serviceType - provider service type
        classes - classes to instantiate as providers
        args - constructor arguments for each provider instance
        Returns:
        providers instantiated from each class in classes with args
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any class in classes has no constructor matching args nor a no-arg constructor

      • fromInstances

        public static <T> Providers<T> fromInstances​(java.lang.Class<T> serviceType,
                                             java.lang.Iterable<? extends T> instances)
        Generates providers from supplied instances.
        Type Parameters:
        T - service type
        Parameters:
        serviceType - provider service type
        instances - instances to use as providers
        Returns:
        instances as providers

      • find

        public java.util.Optional<T> find()
        Locates the sole provider, if one exists.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if multiple providers exist

      • find

        public java.util.Optional<T> find​(java.util.function.Predicate<T> predicate)
        Locates the sole provider which matches a given predicate.
        Parameters:
        predicate - predicate to test
        Returns:
        provider matching predicate, if any
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if multiple providers match predicate

      • findAll

        public java.util.Collection<T> findAll​(java.util.function.Predicate<T> predicate)
        Locates all providers which match a given predicate.
        Parameters:
        predicate - predicate to test
        Returns:
        all providers matching predicate

      • get

        public T get()
        Like find(), but throws an exception if no provider.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if no provider exists
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if multiple providers exist
        See Also:
        find()

        Returns:
